comment: Very easy course. Everything is through email, so you submit your midterm and final grade through email, and the final essay. (That is all you do in the class). You do have to show up to class or it will affect your grade.

TAKE DR.KING!!!!!! The work load is extremely minimal.  Attend class and participate when needed (if you'd like. But the more you participate, the more he will remember your name). He is incredibly kind and every lecture we laugh a bit. It is relaxing to be in his class and the material he reviews is always on D2L. Test are easy!

I took his 2110 summer course, and it was a breeze. There was no homework, no tests besides one final and one midterm, and an international film critique. He is super nice and laid-back! He gives you notes to use for both tests and provides the answer key. You, quite literally, CANNOT fail his class! DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND TAKE HIM! no regrets:)

Such an amazing guy! Only graded on three assignments all year, he is super understanding when it comes to turn-in dates. Class is mainly lectures/conversations. While attendance is not mandatory he encourages you to come and takes note of who is there. If you are looking to pursue English education I recommend taking at least one class of his.
he makes his four-week class so manageable and it's so easy. he doesn't overload us with work and is so sweet. take him!!

This professor is literally the easiest, and best professor I have ever had. 2 assignments, which are easy and graded very easily, and a midterm and final, for which he provides the answer key and lets you grade it yourself, and email him the score. Easiest credit ever. TAKE DAVID KING FOR WHATEVER YOU CAN
This is the easiest class I have had by a mile. Just two assignments, plus a midterm and final. Midterm and final were a joke. Take him, you'll thank me later.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. King is a return to what English classes should be. He is such an empathetic and passionate individual who truly cares about each and every one of his students. He's like a combination of Robin Williams and Mr. Rogers. I cannot recommend him enough!!

What an amazing guy, and a wonderful teacher. Ive already made sure that hell be teaching the next class I take, because Professor King cares about what he teaches so genuinely that you cant help but feel warm towards the literature as well. Easy to contact and always happy to offer extra time/credit for assignments. Get this guy if you can!

This class is a great option if you need to fill an elective credit. It is not a heavy or overwhelming load. 4 papers (1 paper due at the end of the month) on whatever movie/film you want! The papers are required to be about 3 pages (easy!!). This is a great class to take as a senior! 10 out of 10 out recommend!
Professor King is a great teacher. He is very understanding and easy to get a hold of in every situation. I would LOVE to take another class of his. He is Very fair when it comes to grading .
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Dr. King was extremely understanding during the COVID-19 Pandemic! He didn't stress his students out about work because he knew everyone had something going on. Awesome professor, take him!

Literally the sweetest professor you could have. He is extremely caring and provides you with all the tools you need to succeed. He is very lenient with grading and gives wonderful feedback. Ill definitely be looking for his name next time I have to take an English course :)

Dr King has got to be one of the best professors Ive had in college by far. Hes hilarious and great knowledge of the subject hes teaching. The class comprises of screening films and theres two main exams and 4 film journals throughout the semester, but he gives you a lot of freedom with the material needed for the film journals. Take him!

King is a really great professor and really loves teaching english. This class was definitely a lot less writing than comp 1 and 2 but he gives a couple extra credit essays that help your tests. DO THEM. He basically just glances at them and gives you points. The tests were super easy if you just took notes and memorized them. Super nice guy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: King has a way of making everything he loves, things you now love. You will be a better person after his class.

Professor King is absolutely tremendous. He is an amazing professor with an even better outlook on life. Even though I had him for a literature class there wasn't that much reading. His philosophy is that he wants to give you a taste of different types of literature rather than cram a bunch of books down your throat. Take his class.
Highly recommend. Not a heavy workload and he wants you to get a good grade and love his subject at the end of the semester.

Dr. King is the easiest lit professor. Only 2 tests midterm and final, both multiple choice. One paper on a Movie, basically graded for completion. I didn't read any of the assigned readings and still got an A in the class!!!

DO NOT SHOW UP TO CLASS IF YOU ARE SICK - He does NOT like germs & insists you stay home if you even have a slight cough. He's just a sweet man who loves movies. His man crush on Marlon Brando is extremely evident but everything he says is purposeful and profound. He's extremely understanding if you're absent or have to turn in assignments late.

Dr. King is a great professor. It's an easy class, primarily because it's enjoying films and gaining your own perspective. He's very kind when it comes to grading and gives extra credit. Film journal that originally consisted of 5 essays but he dropped it to 4, a take home midterm, and extra credit. They were all fun assignments!

Dr. King is a very interesting, nice person, and obviously knows what he's talking about in regards to lit. Don't bother reading stuff outside of class, we read all of it in class. Not as much discussion as lecture, and he's a bit hard of hearing. It was an easy class, but a bit boring.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. King is one of the best professors in the English department. Everything covered is relevant to the course content and he sprinkles in personal stories. He is fair and respectful. There is only a midterm and a final project that consists of two parts. Show up to class and participate and you'll be fine.

I'm currently taking Dr. King for FILM 3200. I have enjoyed this class all semester long, and I have already decided to take him again next semester. The class is structured as a "get what you give" grading system. There is NO reason for anyone to make a C or below in this course. He offers plenty of extra credit. Great professor!
Caring professor. Knows his stuff. A real wizard.

As an English Major, I thought this class was going to be a step back from writing papers. Nope. Toke his summer class and we have "extra credit," which is actually mandatory because there are only two tests. You have to go out and find the films your writing about, so if you're busy with a full load, don't take this class.

Dr. King is awesome for any class, but ESPECIALLY anything to do with American Lit. He's so passionate about American pop culture and it rubs off on his students. Learned a lot more than I thought I would in this course, and it was pretty simple, too. King's the best. Just take him :)

I honestly don't think I learned anything in this class but Dr. King is so great and offers so much extra credit that it's not even funny. Midterm, Final, and 4 film papers that are basically just reflections. Super easy. Try not to skip that often because he will notice. Gives an extra credit assignment almost every class. He is amazing. Take him.
I took King for English and his lectures and spirit for the literature is amazing! You will walk away inspired and happy to know teachers like him exist.

Dr. King is a phenomenal instructor. He cares a lot about the content and does an incredible job lecturing and relating literature to student experiences. I've taken him twice and will take him a third time - his assignments are time consuming, but not difficult. They challenge you to think and you leave the class really feeling like you've learned

Dr. King loves film and you can tell how passionate he is about the movies watched and discussed in class! I am a COM major and I decided to minor in Film because its super easy to take 4-5 film classes that can also count towards my major in COM. I plan on taking Dr. King for all of my Film classes. He is super chill and gives extra credit.

Dr. King will make you love English even if you are not an Enlighs major. He is a must-take for entry-level courses to senior-level classes. He is so passionate and knows so many little details about authors, stories, and films. The course load is pretty light and students understand exactly what he wants. He is a fair grader & a great professor.

I have taken 4 classes with King (2 English and 2 Film) and he is by far the best professor at KSU. He is so passionate about what he teaches and cares a lot about his students. Show up to class, participate, do your assignments and it's pretty easy to get an A. He has a great deal of knowledge and willingness to help so take advantage of it!

Dr. King is, by far, the greatest professor I have ever had. I took his summer session, and wish I would have taken him during a full semester... his class is a joy, and he makes his lectures super interesting. PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND SIGN UP FOR HIS CLASS!

He is the best!! Aside from being partially deaf and having difficulty hearing students at times, he is one of the best teachers I have ever had. Honestly if you go to class and turn in your assignments you will make an A. I took him for my senior seminar and coasted through the whole semester while my peers were drowning in other senior sems.

I love Dr. King! I've taken three classes with him, including senior seminar. Very simple: 4 responses of 500 words to books you read, one film analysis, and the big paper. You pick the topic and he says go for it! Very honest man, interested in passion of students. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! (Bonus: it's an easy A)
Dr King is an awesome professor. His lectures aren't boring and he made me very interested in the topics. Take him, he's great!

Dr. King is so passionate about Southern Literature that his passion will rub off on you. I had zero interest in this class the first day but boy did that change. He does bring a Confederate flag in on the first day just to get a response out of his students, so be prepared. He enjoys a good talk about Georgia History. GREAT GUY
Dr. King is by far one of the best professors at Kennesaw. While I am not from the South originally, he made me appreciate the history and heritage.
Most helpful and best teacher I have come across in a long time. He enjoys teaching and you can tell in in the class.

Dr. King is literally the best teacher I have ever had. I've been able to take three of his classes at KSU and I love going to school because of his class. If you ever have an opportunity to take him, do it! He is an excellent educator and role model.

Not only one of the best professors but one of the best educators I've ever come across. Teaches students to appreciate the South rather than demean it like so much of academia prefers to do. Lecture/discussion is nothing short of brilliant on a daily basis. I hope to take him again!
He was a wonderful professor. The class was interesting, and we always got into great discussions over the materials. I recommend him. 3 writing assignments that are time consuming, but interesting.

I created a "Rate Your Professors" account explicitly so Dr. King could get the credit he justly deserves for being a phenomenal instructor. He genuinely cares about the material and edifying his students. If you get a chance to study with him, you'd be remiss not to.

Really nice, easy A, but boring class discussions. You should try to go often though because of random stuff on the midterm Study for it. Gives 3-4 library bibliography assignments- time consuming and annoying, but very helpful for future. Everyone waited until the last minute to do it. We'd be there until midnight night before then early am b4 due

I had david King for film and he was awsome. We mainly dicussed the movies we watched and picked out for of our own moviesw that we were interested in and wrote 3 pages on each. He is insightful not hard and is very friendly. A-B in class and am grateful for a teacher that wasn't there to nail you and proove there own self worth.

This is a relaxed class, however he does challenge your mind with the papers he assigns (approximately 3-4 whole semester). There is no homework and he gives extra credit assignments to help boost your grade if needed.  You will use your textbook for the reading but most of the class is used for discussion not pertaining to the class. Good Prof!

Helpful. Excited about subject. Rambled occasionally. Not tons of work due; lenient. Reading is reasonable. Fun class. Dr. King is an awesome professor and I will take him every chance I get. Take him!

KNOWS WHAT HE'S TALKING ABOUT AND LOVES IT. He gave me a serious appreciate for movies that I NEVER had before. I watch old movies now with wide-eyed interest. Loved his intelligent-sounding Southern drawl!! 4 essays and 2 tests. Read the handouts and you have an A. Take him and this class if you can. One of those life-enriching college classes.

Dr. King is a great teacher!  I didn't know what to expect in a college film class.  I was very surprised at all that I learned thanks to Dr. King's all-encompassing knowledge of films.  I'll never watch a movie the way a used to again.  There was a great deal of writing in Dr. King's Film class, but it was really fun.
The Best.  Should not be teaching at Kennesaw State University.  But thank God he is!
Awesome.  Take his class, any of them.

I don't know the acutal number but it was the into to the film courses. It was easy and fun this past summer. He even found some fairly obscure do****entaries on 'Nam that the Blockbuster never seems to carry. Just a neat class.

What an amazing professor!!  He inspires you to take your craft and refine it!  This could very well be a class that will shape your life.  If you can get into this class TAKE IT!  You won't regret it for a minute!

Pretty good guy. He's quite fair and flexible, and in fact accepted several late papers from me, which lord knows, kept me from failing. Keep in mind he's somewhat hard of hearing, so if he doesn't respond to something you say, he's probably not ignoring you.. though he could be.
great person. very relaxed and willing to be flexible. he respects his students
I loved his class!  He is so laid back and teaches that way.  He is what you think an English professor is supposed to be.  I would also take him again.
Best english professor that i've ever had.

One of, if not the best teacher ive had at KSU. Really cares about teaching, and is really loves what he does. Very laid back. Treats students with respect and like adults. One big essay, and two very easy tests. Would take again and again.

Amazing Professor. Class was very laid back, more fun than anything else. There are not many assignments, and the ones that he does give out are somewhat challenging, but still fun. I would take him again in a heartbeat.
He is without a doubt the best professor I've had. Classes are very laid back and he gives you ample time to turn stuff in.
Great teacher, he is really cool and laided back.  Fun Class.
No Comments
Made our class read all the parts of the book that he himself wrote, ignored most of the rest. Consistently late, although we did watch some excellent films.

Dr. King is a really cool guy. His test are straight forward and easy, but you will learn a lot! He often goes off on tangents about life, which makes his class interesting as well.Three test and a film project.Can't say enough good things about the class
